alert.note: Alert for Grimes; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 11:38AM CST until February 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, mixed precipitation expected. Total ice accumulations up to an eighth of an inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...Washington and Grimes Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For more information from the National Weather Service visit https://weather.gov/houston For the latest road conditions for Texas visit https://drivetexas.org A Winter Storm Warning for sleet means that a winter storm system is impacting the area with significant amounts of sleet. Travel is likely to be impacted. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors...make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
